Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for exploring the glorious city of Madrid!”
Reviews.Author: msr11
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 3 days at Jardin Metropolitano in Madrid settling my daughter into the Madrid University as she has gone to live there for a year. It was just perfect! Great position only 2 mins wak from the Metro which links you to the centre in 10 mins. The hotel concierge were helpful and efficient. The decor of the hotel was smart, spotlessly clean and worthy of its 4* rating. I was given a superior room on 5th floor. The room was absolutely beautiful. The furnishings were like a 5* property - the bed solarge and comfortable with crisp white linen, changed every day. A beautifully designed marble bathroom with toiletries including toothbrush and hairbrush!! I am a very critical person when it comes to hotel rooms, and I had absoslutely no cause to complain with the Jardin Metroolitano. I suggest you opt for the Bed and Breakfast rate, as the breakfast was really EXCELLENT. Fresh choices of bread, fresh fruit - strawberries, melon, kiwis, oranges - meat, cheese, fresh omelettes or eggs of your choice and even a Diet corner with soya milk and sugar free products......the best european breakfast I have had in a city in a long time!! Overall I would strongly recommend this hotel for your city break - it was conveniently situated, and quiet, in great location.....and so so beautifully maintained!! Enjoy...

Reviews.Title: “Business trip”
Reviews.Author: David F
Reviews.Content: About 10 mins from Madrid centre by metro ( station 5 min walk away and costs 1.60 euros) the hotel is clean , comfortable and perfect for a business trip or short city break. It is also easy to get to the main airport by Metro with only one change g and 30 min max travel time. Free wifi and good breakfast meant I had no problems with my stay.staff friendly and helpful. Would I stay there again -yes .

Reviews.Title: “Nice Rooms, good price”
Reviews.Author: hot_devil
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night before leaving Madrid. Seemed a little out of the way at first, but it turned out to be alright as it is within walking distance of the metro. Good price with free wifi in the nicely furnished rooms. There's a Carrefour nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Good priced nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nagy76
Reviews.Content: we enjoyed our staying in this hotel. Staff was friendly, rooms are clean and big,breakfast is okay and close to metro so good value for money. Only problem you must be prepared is the noises you can here from your neighbour room. You can here clearly if your neighbour snoring, talking, coughing etc. Just like if you would live with them in the same room. That can be quite embarasssing. Otherwise it is a good hotel to stay.

Reviews.Title: “An overall beautiful hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Pixdix09
Reviews.Content: A wonderful hotel. We had a lovely stay in April. The staff were very friendly and extremely helpful. The rooms were beautiful and very clean. I have no fault with this hotel at all. Would definitely recommend ++++++

Reviews.Title: “Quality hotel, great value”
Reviews.Author: Claire T
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here with friends over the Christmas and New Year period. We booked a triple room - which was huge, with comfy beds and a lovely outlook onto the street below. The room was cleaned daily and was spotless, even though we caused a bit of mess (buying food from the local supermarket and leaving crumbs in various places). Staff were helpful - providing us with extra wine glasses etc when we asked. The location was also really good - not in the city centre but on a direct line so we had a 1 min walk to the tube and then maybe 7-10 min tube ride to Plaza del Sol. It was also on the direct line for museums, city parks, shopping etc. My only moan would be there were no tea and coffee making facilities in the room. However there is an excellent coffee shop nect door where you can get cafe con leche and other such drinks very cheaply. Would I stay here again? Yes.

Reviews.Title: “Very noisy!”
Reviews.Author: Gavin W
Reviews.Content: Nice rooms, great location next to the metro but the biggest problem is noise. You can hear everything that is being said in the adjacent rooms. The walls are paper thin. Otherwise a nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location Best Staff”
Reviews.Author: ali_o_10
Reviews.Content: We stayed ( myself and two adults sons ) at the Jardin Metropolitano Location is excellent with metro and buses infront of the hotel and not far from the city by metro. Shops, restaurants all around the hotel. check in and out is very fast. Reception staff is friendly smiling all the time and will help you with all your requests. room was very big with one king bed and one sofa bed. beds are comfortable room was clean. bath room was clean but not enough soap, shampoos or towels for 3 adults. I had trouble using the safe, not user friendly.. WiFi was free but slow. If i am in madrid again i will stay in this hotel because of price, location. excellent staff, cleaniness and comfortable and spacieus room.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the business traveller”
Reviews.Author: MikTheViking
Reviews.Content: Hotel Jardín Metrolpolitano is set in the heart of Madrid's business district, so it is hardly surprising that it caters to the needs of busy people. But tourists should not worry, a large metro (subway) station is just across the road and serves three of Madrid's major tube lines (so it is only a matter of four or five stations to reach most tourist hot spots). The rooms are large, airy, modern, well equipped and well maintained. There is plenty of storage space and the decor is modern and relaxed. The free wifi connection is a bit slow (and maybe not very secure according to my firewall program) but it works. BBC, SKY and Al Jazeera serve the English-speaking TV audience needs, and there are French, German and Spanish TV channels as well. Next to the highly professional and helpful reception staff area is a snack bar open day and half the night. And through its doors is the entrance to the international cuisine restaurant. There is a secure parking garage under the hotel (and using it can add 20% to your daily bill). We enjoyed the comfort of our stay here and would recommend it to friends and colleagues without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service: Even Spoke English!”
Reviews.Author: runge_sean
Reviews.Content: This hotel went way above and beyond to accomodate our every need. We had been in Madrid for world youth day and we were coming to the end of a very long and exhausting week. The entire hotel staff treated us like royalty. The rooms were amazing! The only problem I even had was with the fact that there were so many buttons. I kept turning on and off the wrong lights. But hey, if thats the only problem I can live with it. I highly reccomend you check out this hotel. It will make you feel like a million bucks.

Reviews.Title: “Great Breakfast Included!”
Reviews.Author: JRS0912
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a triple room. It was spacious and had free Wi Fi and breakfast included in our stay. Had to go down to lobby to obtain WiFi access code and went down again with hotel key so that I could use the safe deposit box in room. Room came with bathrobes and slippers. TV had 2 English only stations one of which was news. Metro stop, Cuatro Cominos on the #6 Circular (loops around downtown) was only 1 block away. Fast food is within a block. Local cuisine was about 3-5 blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: yotsmn
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed 3 nights at the Jardin Metropolitano and couldn't have been more pleased. Reception staff were all very professional and friendly and spoke good English - a special thanks to Tamara Sanchez who was most helpful and stored one of our cases for us while we took a 2 day break to Lisbon. The hotel was also in an excellent location a minutes walk to the Quatro Caminos Metro station which provided quick and easy access to the main Bus Station where we arrived from Valencia, the city (a couple of stops) and the airport (about 45 mins door to door) There was also a large supermarket within 100 metres and many shops and small cafes/restaurants in the vicinity The room itself was extremely nice, being quiet, modern, fresh (like new really) with good aircon, fridge, FREE wifi, lovely large bathroom with double vanity, bidet ( not that we used it) and great shower. Piped music in the room and beautiful big mirror added to the overall ambience. There was also a private balcony off the room but it was very small unfortunately and not large enough to sit out on. The hotel has a restaurant but we are unable to comment on it as it was closed at the time we were there. All in all, a wonderful stay and we would thoroughly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Walls in room are thin - beware”
Reviews.Author: ObservantPerson
Reviews.Content: I am not a particularly light sleeper, but couldn't sleep until the person next door had finished a very, very long phone call. You can hear every movement of a drawer being pulled out, a shoe hitting the floor, the loo roll holder squeaking. I checked in, went to my room for a shower & went down to reception at 19.50 or just before & asked where the restaurant was. "Closed" was the answer, at 20.00. I tried to point out the time, but reception & the man behind the bar just said "closed at 20.00." I guess they wanted you in & out by that time. A 4 star hotel? No, 3 at a push. The piece of soap in the bathroom is almost transparent it's so thin. When I return, I will definately try somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Gets the job done”
Reviews.Author: MontoyaF1
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because we needed to be close by a church that was in this area and there didn't seem to be many great options. Like one reviewer said, it didn't feel like a 4-star hotel, but it was clean and reasonably priced. Make sure if you don't smoke that you reserve a non-smoking room, because we were assigned to a smoking room and had to go back and get the room changed. The staff was helpful and friendly, which is good because I had so many questions and requests while I was there that I was glad that they weren't annoyed with me. The decor throughout the hotel looks a bit dated, but the bathrooms seem to be remodeled. The balcony windows, once shut, block out all of the traffic noise--they were incredibly well insulated. The same unfortunately cannot be said of the walls, because you can hear your neighbors quite well when they come stumbling in after dinner at 1 AM.

Reviews.Title: “value for money, not bad at all”
Reviews.Author: flyingdutchman100
Reviews.Content: Not bad at all, friendly staff, breakfast good. I had however difficulties in operating the aircondioning, which was much too complicated . I did not succeed getting it running and slept with open windows. Consequently I lot of street-noises.

Reviews.Title: “Top Ten Reasons You Should Not Stay in this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: FrequentFlyer19
Reviews.Content: 10. Not so friendly staff 9. No Gym 8. No Restaurant 7. Breakfast is so so 6. They charge extra to use the Safety Deposit Box in the room. That's an abomination!!! 5. Airconditioning/Heater did not work properly. 4. Room was muggy (very strange) everytime we walked in the room smelled like someone took a hot shower and left the bathroom door open 3. Although the hotel is conveniently located near a subway station, there is no decent restaurant or establishment nearby 2. No soundproof. You can hear conversations in the hallway, cars in the street and noises next door. 1. Very Expensive. Not a 4-star hotel in my opinion and definitely not worth 143 euros per night.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: laurie57
Reviews.Content: The Metropolitano was a wonderful place to stay. My son was attending the University nearby for a semester so it was very conveniently located for us. However, the metro is just one block away so it was easy to get anywhere in the city. Our room was spotless and beautiful! The breakfast buffet (included) was great! It included both hot and cold selections. We spent a couple days in Barcelona and did not want to take our big suitcases. They stored them for us and when we returned we were able to get into a room at 10 a.m. Receptionists spoke English and there was no problem communicating. I would highly recommend this hotel and would stay there again in a second.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is not a 4-star hotel.”
Reviews.Author: evan1261
Reviews.Content: I have visited Madrid several times staying at different hotels. I booked the "Hotel Jardin Metropolitano" through my travel agent (carlson wagonlit). The hotel is adverstised as 4 stars; however, it is certainly not a 4-star hotel. It is a clean hotel and the location is good (near the metro) but it lacks the following amenities: - working heater (the heater barely kept the room above freezing) - internet (the wifi internet signal was too weak for the 2nd floor) - a restaurant (there is a bar however that serves some food) - a gym (ok, not a necisity but normally a 4-stay hotel would have some kind if gym or work-out room). Also, not being picky, but most 4-stars actually have soaps and towells. This hotel had 1 tiny bar that lasted for 1 shower and was never replaced. The staff are inattentive and not very helpful. It is a perfectly fine hotel but is more like 2 or 3 stars. I think the only reason it is rated 4 is because of the appointments in the dining room and lobby.

HotelInfo.Name: Jardin Metropolitano
HotelInfo.Address: Avenida Reina Victoria 12, 28003 Madrid, Spain
